alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 17 at 8:15PM CDT until September 18 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN MONROE...WESTERN WAPELLO AND NORTH CENTRAL DAVIS COUNTIES... At 814 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 5 miles southwest of Ottumwa, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Monroe, western Wapello and north central Davis Counties, including the following locations... Blakesburg. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
